remarks: Example of a "Liouville number", a very simple definable transcendental real.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 20-Nov-2014.)
statement:
aaliou3lem.c $e |- F = ( a e. NN |-> ( 2 ^ -u ( ! ` a ) ) ) $.
aaliou3lem.d $e |- L = sum_ b e. NN ( F ` b ) $.
aaliou3lem.e $e |- H = ( c e. NN |-> sum_ b e. ( 1 ... c ) ( F ` b ) ) $.
aaliou3lem9 $p |- -. L e. AA $.
$d F b c $.
$d L a b c $.
